org.orgName: United States District Court, For the Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p:
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
DEPARTMENT OF STATE
To all to whom these presents shall come, Greeting:

I Certify That the attached papers marked respectively, "Gov. exhibit one," numbering one page in length, "Gov. exhibit two," being one page in length, and "Gov. ex. 3," embracing twenty-two pages besides two photographs (on the same copy), are true copies of the originals of such exhibits contained in the record of proceedings had before John C. Whitlock, United States Comissioner for the western district of Washington, in the matter of the application of the British Government for the extradition of Lewis Johnson (or Johnston), which record was forwarded for the said Commissioner to the Department of State of the United States all forms a part of the records of such Department.

In testimony whereof I, Robert Lansing, Secretary of State, have hereunto caused the Seal of the Department of State to be affixed and my name subscribed by the Chief Clerk of the said Department, at the City of Washington, this sixth day of August, 1915.
By Ben D. Davis Chief Clerk.
